abstract: The hole over the Arctic now rivals the one over the Antarctic, where a hole has formed in the ozone layer every spring since the 1980s.
snippet: The hole over the Arctic now rivals the one over the Antarctic, where a hole has formed in the ozone layer every spring since the 1980s.
lead_paragraph: For the first time since record-keeping began, destruction of the ozone layer over the Arctic in early 2011 was comparable to that in the Antarctic ozone hole, scientists report. [Nature]

headline.main: On Our Radar: Gaping Hole in Arctic Ozone
